intro: Pelea ovata, commonly known as the oval pelea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and has narrow, elongated leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a distinctive central disk surrounded by ray florets. Pelea ovata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
